doc.after: A human society is a group of people related to each other through continued relations or a large social grouping sharing the same geographical or virtual territory same interests subject to the same political authority and dominant cultural expectations Human societies are characterized by patterns of relationships social relations between individuals who share a distinctive culture and institutions A given society may be described as the sum total of such relationships among its constituent members In the social sciences a larger society often evinces stratification and or dominance patterns in subgroups
